Background.text:
The 2015 FDA Pregnancy and Lactation Labeling Rule (PLLR) replaces the previously used pregnancy categories (A, B, C, D, X) and creates new labeling categories
Drugs approved by the FDA after the PLLR final rule will no longer be assigned a pregnancy category letter
New drug labeling categories:
8.1 - Pregnancy (including labor and delivery)
8.2 - Lactation (including nursing mothers)
8.3 - Females and Males of reproductive potential
Labels will provide a narrative summary of risk and will summarize available human and animal risk data.
